required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Establishment and Characterization of Meningioma Patient-derived Organoids
clinical_study.official_title: Establishment and Characterization of Meningioma Patient-derived Organoids

brief_summary.textblock: In this study, meningioma organoids will be established from patients' tissues and the characterization of the organoid will be performed.

detailed_description.textblock:
Aims and Hypothesis to be tested:
The investigators hypothesized that the derived organoid should have a similar morphological and genetic mutation signatures to the patient primary tissue.
Study period: 1 year for patient recruitment and organoid generation from patient tumor
Study population: 30
Study samples:
Patient's meningioma tumor sample are collected from patients with surgical needs. Sample collected are used for organoid culture. Morphological and genetic characteristics will be compared between the patient tumor sample and the corresponding derived organoids
Primary outcome measures:
Whole exome sequencing data of patient tumor tissue and patients-derived organoids

primary_outcome.description: DNA extracted from patient tumor tissue and patients-derived organoids will be perform whole exome sequencing for genetic characterization.

secondary_outcome.description: H&E staining and meningioma markers immunostaining

study_pop.textblock: Patients with meningioma admitted to Prince Wales Hospitals neurosurgical services

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Adult patients (aged >18 years) with meningioma
2. Admission into Prince Wales hospitals neurosurgical services
3. Patients with surgical needs of meningioma removal
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Patients (or next-of-kin as appropriate) refuse to participate into the study

facility.name: Department of Surgery, The Chinese University of Hong Kong
